Bedrock

A minimalist boilerplate for Express apps.

Install v0.1.2 View on GitHub

Bedrock comes with a few Handlebars helpers that makes it easier for you to write HTML/CSS.

{{addLocalCSS}}

The addLocalCSS helper lets you add local css files on a per-page basis. For example: 

{{addLocalCSS "path/to/app.css"}}

The example above will load app.css when the view is rendered.

{{addRemoteCSS}}

The addRemoteCSS helper lets you add remote CSS files when the view is rendered. 

{{addRemoteCSS "//maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.2.0/css/bootstrap.min.css"}}

The example above will load a new CSS file when the view is rendered.

{{addLocalJS}}

The addLocalJS helper lets you add local JavaScript files when the view is rendered. For example: 

{{addLocalJS "path/to/app.js"}}

The example above will load app.js when the view is rendered.

{{setTitle}}

The setTitle helper lets you set the HTML <title> attribute for a given view. For example: 

{{setTitle "Bedrock - Helpers"}}
